title: Senkaku Islands
summary: The Senkaku Islands (尖閣諸島, Senkaku-shotō, variants: 尖閣群島 Senkaku-guntō[8] and 尖閣列島 Senkaku-rettō[9]) are a group of uninhabited islands in the East China Sea. They are located northeast of Taiwan, east of China, west of Okinawa Island, and north of the southwestern end of the Ryukyu Islands. They are known in mainland China as the Diaoyu Islands or Diaoyu Dao and its affiliated islands (Chinese: 钓鱼岛及其附属岛屿; pinyin: Diàoyúdǎo jí qí fùshǔ dǎoyǔ; also simply 钓鱼岛),[1] in Taiwan as the Tiaoyutai Islands[10][11][12][13] / Diaoyutai Islands (Chinese: 釣魚臺列嶼; pinyin: Diàoyútái liè yǔ),[14][15][16][17] and in the Western world are sometimes referred to by the historical name Pinnacle Islands.[18][19][20][21] In Okinawan they are called ʔiyukubajima (魚蒲葵島).[22] In Yaeyama dialect, they are called iigunkubajima.
